title: Keyless Ignition and Immobiliser System

body.body: Keyless Ign and Immobiliser System PM1 PR1 PS1 PRC PSC

- situated in the instrument pack. The light will flash on and off for 24 hours to show that the engine immobiliser is on. When the ignition switch is turned to the ON position the immobiliser and the indicator light will be off. If the indicator light remains on it indicates that the immobiliser has a malfunction that requires investigation. If an accessory alarm is fitted, the immobiliser indicator light will only illuminate when the conditions described in the accessory alarm instructions are met.

- Situated on the upper yoke. The ESL will activate to lock the steering when requested, provided that the motorcycle is stationary and the steering is positioned to full left hand lock to enable locking.

- situated on top of the camshaft cover. This control module communicates with the transponder chip in the key via the LF antenna, and with the engine ECM. The keyless ECM will only allow the motorcycle’s electronic systems to turn on and the engine to start if a matching signal is received.

- there are two LF Antenna on this model. One is situated on the right hand side of the rear mudguard under the passenger seat. The second is under the instruments support maulding. The transponder chip in the ignition key is activated when it is in range of the LF antenna. The signal from the chip is interpreted by the keyless ECM.

- situated inside the ignition key. The chip is activated when requested by the keyless ECM, providing the key is in range of the LF antenna (within one meter/three feet for smart keys, within 50 mm for passive keys).

metadata.ModelsTaxonomyLink: PWC; PSC; PRC; PS1; PR1; PM1

body.body: When the motorcycle is delivered from the factory it is supplied with one smart key and one passive key.
An additional smart key can be purchased from your Triumph dealer. However, only three keys can be programmed to the motorcycle. This can be any combination.
A previously paired key must be present when pairing a new key.
Make sure all keys to be paired are present before starting the key pairing process.
Keys can be deleted or added to the immobiliser system using the Triumph diagnostic tool.
To make sure that the immobiliser system functions correctly note the following:
Do not put any magnetic materials on the same key ring as the motorcycle key.
Do not put any other ignition key with a transponder chip fitted near the motorcycle key when in use.
Do not modify the immobiliser system.
Do not submerge the key in water or any other fluid.
Do not drop or strike the key against hard material.
The table below explains the immobiliser warning light flashing codes.
Key out of range, disabled or no keys paired
One long flash followed with one long flash
Electronic steering lock pin cannot disengage
One long flash followed with one short flash
Electronic steering lock pin cannot engage
One long flash followed with two short flashes
One long flash followed with three short flashes
Electronic steering lock not connected or not communicating

search: Keyless Ignition and Immobiliser System
System Components and Operation
Alarm/immobiliser warning indicator light

- situated in the instrument pack. The light will flash on and off for 24 hours to show that the engine immobiliser is on. When the ignition switch is turned to the ON position the immobiliser and the indicator light will be off. If the indicator light remains on it indicates that the immobiliser has a malfunction that requires investigation. If an accessory alarm is fitted, the immobiliser indicator light will only illuminate when the conditions described in the accessory alarm instructions are met.
Electronic Steering Lock (ESL)

- Situated on the upper yoke. The ESL will activate to lock the steering when requested, provided that the motorcycle is stationary and the steering is positioned to full left hand lock to enable locking.
Keyless ECM

- situated on top of the camshaft cover. This control module communicates with the transponder chip in the key via the LF antenna, and with the engine ECM. The keyless ECM will only allow the motorcycle’s electronic systems to turn on and the engine to start if a matching signal is received.
Low Frequency (LF) Antenna

- there are two LF Antenna on this model. One is situated on the right hand side of the rear mudguard under the passenger seat. The second is under the instruments support maulding. The transponder chip in the ignition key is activated when it is in range of the LF antenna. The signal from the chip is interpreted by the keyless ECM.
Transponder chip

- situated inside the ignition key. The chip is activated when requested by the keyless ECM, providing the key is in range of the LF antenna (within one meter/three feet for smart keys, within 50 mm for passive keys).
Keys
When the motorcycle is delivered from the factory it is supplied with one smart key and one passive key.
An additional smart key can be purchased from your Triumph dealer. However, only three keys can be programmed to the motorcycle. This can be any combination.
A previously paired key must be present when pairing a new key.
Make sure all keys to be paired are present before starting the key pairing process.
Keys can be deleted or added to the immobiliser system using the Triumph diagnostic tool.
To make sure that the immobiliser system functions correctly note the following:
Do not put any magnetic materials on the same key ring as the motorcycle key.
Do not put any other ignition key with a transponder chip fitted near the motorcycle key when in use.
Do not modify the immobiliser system.
Do not submerge the key in water or any other fluid.
Do not drop or strike the key against hard material.
Immobiliser Warning Indicator Light
The table below explains the immobiliser warning light flashing codes.
Immobiliser Warning Indicator Light
Fault
Possible Cause
One long flash
Key authentication fault
Key out of range, disabled or no keys paired
One long flash followed with one long flash
Electronic steering lock disengagement fault
Electronic steering lock pin cannot disengage
One long flash followed with one short flash
Electronic steering lock engagement fault
Electronic steering lock pin cannot engage
One long flash followed with two short flashes
Electronic steering lock ID mismatch
Electronic steering lock not matched
One long flash followed with three short flashes
Electronic steering lock no response
Electronic steering lock not connected or not communicating
